page.title: 01LOW LYING FARM LAND
page.content: This area consists of low lying farm land with undulating hills, the highest point being only 31 mtrs. The south west corner of the area is covered by Kirkwall Airport (Orkneys main airport). Immediately east the ground is rough grazing land, formerly part of the war-time air base of which the ruins of several buildings still remain. The rest of the area is intensively farmed grassland, for cattle & sheep. Many of the farms being small holdings each about 1 kilometre apart. The land south east of Whitecleaat Farm is a peat bog where peat for fuel is dug, but this area is now being drained ready for cultivation. The loch of Tankerness in the east is a fresh water loch, though it is little used for fishing it is well stocked with trout. Inganess Bay is a well sheltered bay
